page.title: 19MAWNAN LANDSCAPE
page.content: Mawnan is an area of outstanding natural beauty containing many differing{habitats}with a variety of wildlife. Few habitats are spoiled but many are in endangered through the increase in population especially in the Tourist season. In the{river}boats disturb fish,rubbish,oil and sewage pollute the shore.{Farmers}use pesticides but few take down hedges. Most hedge trimming is now done after the flowers have seeded. Many{trees have died with Dutch Elm disease and others around Durgan are coming to the end of their natural life. There are little signs of tree planting except for the{National}Trust who own a considerable amount of land. Mawnan won the{Best Kept Village Award}last year. The Cubs,Brownies and Guides help to keep the village tidy while everyone works hard in their gardens.
